subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized and Theories overlaps
msgSnippet: I m also struggling with this. Why have two concepts that deal with the same thing. Is it likely that Parameterized will be replaced by Theories when they
messageBody:
I'm also "struggling" with this. Why have two concepts that deal with the
same thing. Is it likely that Parameterized will be replaced by Theories
when they become a integral part of Junit?

I do see one difference between them, but this is not made clear in the
documentation.

The Parameterized runners parametrize the fixture, whereas Theories
"parametrizes" the test method.

Is that indeed the difference between them and will they therefore remain
both?

tx.,



toalexsmail wrote:
>
> There is 2 runners that did the same work. More precisely, all work
> that can be done by Parameterized runner can be done by Theories
> runner. I think it should be consider to refactor their
> implementations and to write more documentation about use of Theories.
>
>
>

--
View this message in context: http://www.nabble.com/Parameterized-and-Theories-overlaps-tp16004982p20029916.html
